nodes.bodyText: why do you need allOf here?
containsInAnyOrder returns Iterable<? extends T> while hasItems returns Iterable, so I use allOf to "align"  types
public <T> Matcher<Iterable<? extends T>> getComparisonRule(List<T> items) ?
Github hidden type param for hasItems, that's Iterable < T >
would you mind adding the documentation for this step?

[WARNING]
To be implemented
